climbs.name: Walking the Dog
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer and Dave Stoner, February 1988

content.description: Fun face climbing up the west face of the summit block with a great view the reward. You can rap off chains of an adjacent route around the corner (Dorothy does Josh) to descend.
content.location:
Located just right of

The Hourglass

and on the right side of the obvious wide crack.

Scramble up 3rd class to the base or climb

The Lollipop Guild

to approach.

climbs.name: Toto Meets the Bighorn
climbs.fa: Brandt Allen and Geoff Archer, January 1991

content.description: Climb double cracks in dark rock to a ledge and then continue up the gritty crack in a pinnacle to a bolted anchor.
content.location:
Located midway between

The Lollipop Guild

and

Ruby Slippers

starting from ground level.

climbs.name: Ruby Slippers
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer and Bill Freeman, February 1989

content.description: This clean slab on good rock is a worthwhile tick if in the area and the slight runout at the top let's you know this is Joshua Tree.
content.location:
Located roughly 50 meters right of

Toto Meets the Bighorn

on a south facing slab.

climbs.name: The Lollipop Guild
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer and Brandt Allen, January 1991

content.description:
Climb the nice slab passing two bolts and belay on a ledge at the top. Downclimb off right down a chimney or further right down easy broken terrain.

Also useful as an approach pitch to

The Hourglass

and

Walking the Dog

.
content.protection: 2 bolts (3/8"), gear to 2.5 inches for the anchor
content.location:
Down and left from the summit block and

Walking the Dog

.

content.description: Interesting face climbing up the face of a huge block split by a wide crack. You can rap off chains of an adjacent route around the corner (Dorothy does Josh) to descend.
content.location:
Left of

Walking the Dog

and just left of an obvious wide crack splitting the block.

Scramble up 3rd class to the base or climb

The Lollipop Guild

to approach.
